author: Thomas Grove
title: The Real Drama in Russia’s Election: How Many Voters Will Show Up?
text:
MOSCOW—On a peninsula that juts into the Arctic, regional authorities are offering iPhone X smartphones, iPads and Apple Watches to coax people to polling stations Sunday for a presidential election where everyone already knows the outcome.
Russian President Vladimir Putin has an approval rating of around 80%, according to polls, making the challenge for the Kremlin not how to assure his victory against a cast of weak opponents, but how to boost voter turnout and legitimize an uncompetitive election.
...
